usamriidPathDiscov.make_summary module¶

exception usamriidPathDiscov.make_summary.MissingProjectFile[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

usamriidPathDiscov.make_summary.blast_results_for_(blastfile, blastcol, filterval)[source]¶

Return rows from blast output that match row[blastcol] == filterval

usamriidPathDiscov.make_summary.contig_info(projdir)[source]¶

Merge together results from contig.id and contig_numreads.txt file and return as a dictionary keyed by contigname

usamriidPathDiscov.make_summary.contigs_for(projdir, blastcol, blastval)[source]¶

Merge together contig information from various sources and return information [{contigname, length, numreads, accession, family, genus, description},...]

@param blastcol - Column in blast tab file that will be used to filter @param blastval - Value to filter the blastcol on

usamriidPathDiscov.make_summary.format_dict(contig, keys)[source]¶
usamriidPathDiscov.make_summary.format_summary(summary)[source]¶

Format summary into multiple rows based on longest of contig or unassembled reads Formats as rows of tab separated values

usamriidPathDiscov.make_summary.get_n50(numlist)[source]¶
Parameters:numlist (list) – List of numbers

Returns the N50 value of the passed list of numbers. Code from http://seqanswers.com/forums/showpost.php?p=9414&postcount=7

Based on the Broad Institute definition: https://www.broad.harvard.edu/crd/wiki/index.php/N50

usamriidPathDiscov.make_summary.group_blast_by_(blastfile, filtercol, filterval, groupbycol)[source]¶

Filter blast results down by filtercol == filterval then group results by groupbycol

Number of non host reads from prinseq

usamriidPathDiscov.make_summary.parse_blast_report(reportpath, filterf=None)[source]¶

Return row by row results from a blast report in tab format

@param filterf - Function that will filter the results being supplied one row and returns True for rows to keep and False for rows to discard

usamriidPathDiscov.make_summary.parse_tab_file(tabfile, fields=None)[source]¶
usamriidPathDiscov.make_summary.r1r2_count(steppath)[source]¶

Merge together counts for R1 and R2 inside of steppath Raises MissingProjectFile if < 1 .count file found

usamriidPathDiscov.make_summary.read_count(countfile)[source]¶

Get counts for every line in count file returns a dictionary keyed by every item in the first column with value of the item in right column

Number of reads total

usamriidPathDiscov.make_summary.unassembled_reads(projdir)[source]¶

Returns counts for total unassembled reads and num blast unassembled

usamriidPathDiscov.make_summary.unassembled_report(projdir, kingdom, groupby='family')[source]¶

Returns the grouped blast results filtered first by kingdom and then grouped by groupby field Each key in the returned dictionary will be the groupby column uniq values Combines R1 & R2 results Adds a new key called accession with the parsed out accession

usamriidPathDiscov.verifyproject module¶

usamriidPathDiscov.verifyproject.filestemplate_to_listing(projpath, projname, template)[source]¶

Convert string template to list of file/directory paths

usamriidPathDiscov.verifyproject.main()[source]¶
usamriidPathDiscov.verifyproject.verify_files(projectpath, files_template)[source]¶

Use a files_template to generate a listing of expected files $projpath will be replaced with projectpath $projname will be replaced with basename(projpath)

Ensure each file is present and stat(file).st_size > 0 Ensure each directory is present Symbolic links will be checked for existance and that they point to valid files

return an empty list if all is well otherwise return list of tuples of
(filedirpath, ‘Reason why did not pass’)
usamriidPathDiscov.verifyproject.verify_project(projectpath, projname, templates)[source]¶

Verify project has all files listed in all templates templates is a list of template paths

usamriidPathDiscov.verifyproject.verify_standard_stages_files(projectpath, templatedir)[source]¶

Hardcoded verification of standard stages
